TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit WorkflowOwnershipException extends System.Exception

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when the workflow runtime engine attempts to load a workflow instance that is currently loaded by another workflow runtime engine instance. Additionally, this exception is thrown when the workflow runtime engine attempts to save a workflow after the ownership timeout that was specified while loading the workflow has expired.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
The <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException> is used by persistence services which support the capability for multiple applications to access the same database. In such an environment, an instance of the workflow runtime may try to load a workflow that is already loaded by another instance of the workflow runtime engine. For example, the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.SQLWorkflowPersistenceService> class throws the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException> when this situation occurs.
If you implement a persistence service that throws the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException> you should provide the <xref:System.Guid> of the workflow instance for which the exception occurs by using an appropriate constructor for the class or setting the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A> property before you throw the exception.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic)| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|A system-supplied localized description.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Guid>.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Guid instanceId) cil managed

Docs.param: The of the workflow instance for which this exception occurred.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using a specified workflow instance .

remarks.format:
## Remarks `instanceId` is equivalent to the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.InstanceId%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the workflow instance. The <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance is initialized to a system-supplied message that describes the error and takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic)| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|A system-supplied localized description.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A>|The <xref:System.Guid> of the workflow instance, specified by `instanceId`, for which this exception occurred.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using a specified error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The content of the `message` parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture. If you use this constructor you should explicitly set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A> before you throw the exception.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Guid>.|

The message that describes the error.

## Remarks `instanceId` is equivalent to the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.InstanceId%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the workflow instance. The content of the `message` parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic)| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A>|The <xref:System.Guid> of the workflow instance, specified by `instanceId`, for which this exception occurred.|

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is called during serialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
For more information see XML and SOAP Serialization.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference ( in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is supplied to the constructor or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the `innerException` parameter does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor. The content of the `message` parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture. If you use this constructor you should explicitly set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A> before you throw the exception.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Guid>.|

MemberSignature.Value: public WorkflowOwnershipException (Guid instanceId, string message, Exception innerException);

Docs.param: The of the workflow instance for which this exception occurred.
The message that describes the error.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference ( in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using a specified workflow instance , a specified error message, and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is supplied to the constructor or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the `innerException` parameter does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
`instanceId` is equivalent to the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.InstanceId%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the workflow instance. The content of the `message` parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.InstanceId%2A>|The <xref:System.Guid> of the workflow instance, specified by `instanceId`, for which this exception occurred.|

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: A that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
A that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Sets the object with the of the workflow instance associated with this exception, and additional exception information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowOwnershipException.GetObjectData%2A> sets a <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> with all the exception object data targeted for serialization. During deserialization the exception object is reconstituted from the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> transmitted over the stream.
For more information see XML and SOAP Serialization.

Docs.exception: is a null reference ( in Visual Basic)

Docs.summary: Gets the of the workflow instance for which this exception was thrown.
Docs.value: is equivalent to the property of the workflow instance.
